intro: Gnaphaliothamnus aecidiocephalus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its woolly, silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical research.
